pyslam.epipolar_models.EpipolarModelCore#

This module implements core logic for epipolar models.

Implements a base error class to define error functions for epipolar models, among other things.

Module Contents#

Functions#

triangulatePoint(→ jax.numpy.ndarray)

A function that takes 2 cameras, and 2 Keypoints corresponding to the same point in 3D,
pyslam.epipolar_models.EpipolarModelCore.triangulatePoint(p1: jax.numpy.ndarray, p2: jax.numpy.ndarray, pointOne: jax.numpy.ndarray, pointTwo: jax.numpy.ndarray) → jax.numpy.ndarray#

A function that takes 2 cameras, and 2 Keypoints corresponding to the same point in 3D, and triangulates the point in 3D.

Parameters:

  • p1 – The camera matrix of the first camera; assumed to be 3x4.

  • p2 – The camera matrix of the second camera; assumed to be 3x4.

  • pointOne – The projection of the point onto the first camera, as a heterogenous 2D numpy array.

  • pointTwo – The projection of the point onto the second camera, as a heterogenous 2D numpy array.

Returns:

A 3-tall column vector representing the point’s 3D position, in heterogenous coordinates.
